alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:32AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Powell, northwestern Owsley, Estill, northern Jackson, Lee and southwestern Wolfe Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 332 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Virden to Fox to near Winston to 6 miles west of Richmond. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Clay City, Sandhill, Rice Station, Waltersville, Powell Valley, Wiseman Crossing Station, Winston, Fox, Spout Springs and Virden around 340 AM EDT. Stanton, Irvine, West Irvine, Blackburn, Weedon, North Irvine, Calloway Crossing, Vaughns Mill, Wisemantown and Kings Station around 345 AM EDT. Ravenna, South Irvine, Knowlton, Jinks, Cow Creek, Station Camp, Willow Tree and Cottage Furnace around 350 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Doe Creek, Furnace, Pitts, Fitchburg, Drip Rock, Rogers Chapel, Texola, Pryse, Pilot, Shade, Alumbaugh, Wagersville, Blanton Flats, Cobhill, Evelyn, See, Leighton, Crystal, Patsey, Foxtown, Standing Rock, Leeco, Willow Shoals, Pinnacle, Old Orchard, Old Landing, Fixer, Whynot, Wind Cave, Greeley, Beattyville, Fincastle, Whisman, Zachariah, Hisel, Torrent, Zoe, Yellow Rock, Heidelberg and Arvel. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 14 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
